title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.1.2 INCLUSIVE&QUALITY EDUCATION

description.narrative: 1.1.2 By end 2016, the Ministry of Education and Science support inclusive and quality education through systematic and effective addressing the issue of OOSC, fostering multilingual and multicultural education policy, promoting the issue of teacher quality and availability, improving emergency preparedness of the sector and generating knowledge to advance the issue of quality and inclusiveness of basic education. (RKLA4), which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1.1 Equitable and Responsive Systems children and women have increased access to quality and responsive services, including social benefits

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 1.1.2 By end 2016, the Ministry of Education and Science support inclusive and quality education through systematic and effectiveaddressing the issue of OOSC, fostering multilingual and multicultural education policy, promoting the issue of teacher quality andavailability, improving emergency preparedness of the sector and generating knowledge to advance the issue of quality andinclusiveness of basic education. (RKLA4)

description.narrative: Risks of being left out of school and dropping out addressed at national level in collaboration with other sectors, while children in target schools benefit from multilingual learning | Status:On-track | As-of Date:18/12/2017

title.narrative: % of qualified school teachers who teach in their area of expertise (by gender, area, age, subject)
Availability of accurate and reliable data on out-of-school children and learning environment in basic education, and status of utilization by decision makers

baseline.value: The current system is not sufficient to collect data on out-of school children, the data is fragmented and insufficient (Source: Concept Note on EMIS, Sep 2011)

target.value: 2016:Functional data being used, contributes for evidence-based policies, providing timely and accurate data on OOSC

actual.value: 2016:Achieved. EMIS is in place, Concept note is approved in 2015, the database is being used for linking Civil Registry database with unique PIN of students.
